availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Owsley (Kentucky governor, judge, and politician.)

body.p: Kentucky governor, judge, and politician. Virginia native. Son of William Owsley. Married to Elizabeth Gill Owsley in Garrard County, Kentucky in 1804. Judge on Court of Appeals from 1812 to 1828. Resident of Garrard County in 1820. Owned fifteen enslaved people in Garrard County in 1820. Resident of Garrard County in 1830. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Garrard County in 1830. Resident of Franklin County in 1840. Owned seven enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1840. Governor of Kentucky from 1844 to 1848. Farmer in Boyle County in 1850. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in 1850. Retired judge in Boyle County in 1860. Owned thirty-one enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1860. Household owned ten other enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1860. Emancipated Kitty [Unknown] in Boyle County upon his death in 1862.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District No 2, p. 349A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District No 2, p. 572.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 842.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p.156A.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Boyle County Wills, vol. 1-2, 1842-1847, p. 260-261.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Garrard County Marriages, Film # 000183256, p. 84.
William B. Allen, A History of Kentucky (Louisville, KY: Bradley & Gilbert, Publishers, 1872).
